issue.title: enhancement: Improve voice integration with permissions and fallback

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### ✨ Enhancement: Improve voice integration with permissions and fallback

**Problem Description:**
Voice commands rely on microphone access, but in the UAT environment, the microphone remained disabled, rendering `voice on/off` ineffective. The current implementation lacks robust handling for microphone permissions and user feedback.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 5. Recommendations

**Proposed Solution:**
Improve the voice integration by providing a more user-friendly experience around microphone permissions and functionality.

**Actions:**
- Implement a clear prompt for microphone permissions when voice features are first accessed.
- Provide informative feedback to the user if microphone permissions are denied or unavailable.
- Consider a fallback mechanism or alternative input methods if voice input is not feasible.
- Update the `help` documentation for voice commands to clarify microphone requirements.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Users are clearly prompted for microphone access.
- The system provides actionable feedback on microphone status.
- Voice commands function reliably when permissions are granted, or a graceful fallback is provided.

issue.title: enhancement: Clarify 'matrix' command relation to particle effects

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### ✨ Enhancement: Clarify 'matrix' command relation to particle effects

**Problem Description:**
The `matrix` command acts as an alias for the matrix rain particle effect, but its behavior can be confusing. The initial toggle prints both "Matrix rain disabled" and "Matrix rain enabled" depending on the previous state, which is not ideal user feedback.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Proposed Solution:**
Clarify the `matrix` command's relation to the broader `effects` system. This could involve:
- Updating the command's output to be more precise (e.g., "Matrix rain is now [enabled/disabled]").
- Adding a note in the `help` documentation for `matrix` that it is a shortcut for `effects matrix on/off`.
- Potentially deprecating the standalone `matrix` command in favor of exclusively using the `effects` command for consistency.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The `matrix` command provides clear and unambiguous feedback on its state.
- The documentation clearly explains the relationship between `matrix` and the `effects` system.

issue.title: enhancement: Implement missing commands or clarify unavailability

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### ✨ Enhancement: Implement missing commands or clarify unavailability

**Problem Description:**
Several intuitive commands (e.g., `home`, `privacy`, `report`, `resume`, `todo`) are not implemented in the terminal interface, leading to user confusion when attempted.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
Attempting to execute these commands results in "Command not found" errors.

**Proposed Solution:**
Either implement the missing commands to provide expected functionality or, if they are intentionally not implemented, update the `help` command's output or auto-completion suggestions to clearly indicate their unavailability. This will improve user experience and reduce confusion.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Missing commands are implemented with their intended functionality, OR
- The `help` command explicitly lists unavailable commands, OR
- Auto-completion does not suggest unimplemented commands.

issue.title: bug: Split mode monitor panes are blank

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: Split mode monitor panes are blank

**Problem Description:**
When entering split mode (`split` command), the right-hand monitor panes are empty in the test environment, even though the `monitor` command shows system status normally in full-screen mode.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
1.  Execute `split` command.
2.  The interface splits into two panes.
3.  The right-hand monitor pane displays no content.

**Expected Behavior:**
The right-hand monitor pane in split mode should display system status information, similar to the `monitor` command's output.

**Remediation:**
Investigate the rendering logic for the split mode monitor. This may involve checking data binding, CSS/layout issues specific to split mode, or JavaScript rendering logic for the monitor components in this view.

issue.title: bug: Partial voice functionality (microphone access)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: Partial voice functionality (microphone access)

**Problem Description:**
Voice commands (`voice on/off`) are ineffective in the UAT environment. The report indicates that voice features require microphone permissions, but in testing, the microphone remained disabled.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
Attempting to activate voice commands (e.g., `voice on`) results in "Voice inactive" and no microphone access.

**Expected Behavior:**
If microphone access is required, the system should:
1.  Prompt the user for microphone permissions.
2.  Provide clear guidance if permissions are denied or unavailable.
3.  Function correctly if permissions are granted.

**Remediation:**
Investigate the voice integration to ensure proper handling of microphone permissions. Implement user prompts for permission requests and provide informative feedback when access is not granted. Consider fallback mechanisms or clear instructions for users in environments where microphone access is restricted.

issue.title: bug: Theme indicator mismatch in header

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: Theme indicator mismatch

**Problem Description:**
When the terminal theme is changed using the `theme <name>` command, the visual theme updates correctly, but the theme label in the top header always displays "THEME: MATRIX", regardless of the active theme.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
1.  Execute `theme cyberpunk` (or any other theme name).
2.  The terminal's visual appearance changes to 'cyberpunk'.
3.  The header still shows "THEME: MATRIX".

**Expected Behavior:**
The theme indicator in the header should dynamically update to reflect the currently active theme (e.g., "THEME: CYBERPUNK").

**Remediation:**
Investigate the frontend JavaScript responsible for updating the header's theme label. Ensure it correctly reads the active theme and updates the display accordingly.

issue.title: bug: 'task create' command fails with 'this.getLabelsForTask is not a function'

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: 'task create' command failure

**Problem Description:**
During UAT, the `task create` command consistently failed with a `this.getLabelsForTask is not a function` error. This prevents the creation of new GitHub issues directly from the terminal interface.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
Executing `task create "title" priority "body"` results in an error message indicating a missing function (`this.getLabelsForTask`).

**Expected Behavior:**
The `task create` command should successfully parse the provided arguments (title, priority, body) and create a new GitHub issue, correctly assigning labels based on the priority.

**Remediation:**
Investigate the implementation of the `task create` command and ensure that `getLabelsForTask` (or its equivalent functionality) is correctly defined and accessible within its scope. Ensure proper parsing of priority labels and graceful handling of any missing functions.

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### ✨ Enhancement: Implement missing commands or clarify unavailability

**Problem Description:**
Several intuitive commands (e.g., `home`, `privacy`, `report`, `resume`, `todo`) are not implemented in the terminal interface, leading to user confusion when attempted.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
Attempting to execute these commands results in "Command not found" errors.

**Proposed Solution:**
Either implement the missing commands to provide expected functionality or, if they are intentionally not implemented, update the `help` command's output or auto-completion suggestions to clearly indicate their unavailability. This will improve user experience and reduce confusion.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- Missing commands are implemented with their intended functionality, OR
- The `help` command explicitly lists unavailable commands, OR
- Auto-completion does not suggest unimplemented commands.

issue.title: bug: Split mode monitor panes are blank

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: Split mode monitor panes are blank

**Problem Description:**
When entering split mode (`split` command), the right-hand monitor panes are empty in the test environment, even though the `monitor` command shows system status normally in full-screen mode.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
1.  Execute `split` command.
2.  The interface splits into two panes.
3.  The right-hand monitor pane displays no content.

**Expected Behavior:**
The right-hand monitor pane in split mode should display system status information, similar to the `monitor` command's output.

**Remediation:**
Investigate the rendering logic for the split mode monitor. This may involve checking data binding, CSS/layout issues specific to split mode, or JavaScript rendering logic for the monitor components in this view.

issue.title: bug: Partial voice functionality (microphone access)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: Partial voice functionality (microphone access)

**Problem Description:**
Voice commands (`voice on/off`) are ineffective in the UAT environment. The report indicates that voice features require microphone permissions, but in testing, the microphone remained disabled.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
Attempting to activate voice commands (e.g., `voice on`) results in "Voice inactive" and no microphone access.

**Expected Behavior:**
If microphone access is required, the system should:
1.  Prompt the user for microphone permissions.
2.  Provide clear guidance if permissions are denied or unavailable.
3.  Function correctly if permissions are granted.

**Remediation:**
Investigate the voice integration to ensure proper handling of microphone permissions. Implement user prompts for permission requests and provide informative feedback when access is not granted. Consider fallback mechanisms or clear instructions for users in environments where microphone access is restricted.

issue.title: bug: Theme indicator mismatch in header

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: Theme indicator mismatch

**Problem Description:**
When the terminal theme is changed using the `theme <name>` command, the visual theme updates correctly, but the theme label in the top header always displays "THEME: MATRIX", regardless of the active theme.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
1.  Execute `theme cyberpunk` (or any other theme name).
2.  The terminal's visual appearance changes to 'cyberpunk'.
3.  The header still shows "THEME: MATRIX".

**Expected Behavior:**
The theme indicator in the header should dynamically update to reflect the currently active theme (e.g., "THEME: CYBERPUNK").

**Remediation:**
Investigate the frontend JavaScript responsible for updating the header's theme label. Ensure it correctly reads the active theme and updates the display accordingly.

issue.title: bug: 'task create' command fails with 'this.getLabelsForTask is not a function'

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

issue.body:
### 🐛 Bug Report: 'task create' command failure

**Problem Description:**
During UAT, the `task create` command consistently failed with a `this.getLabelsForTask is not a function` error. This prevents the creation of new GitHub issues directly from the terminal interface.

**UAT Report Reference:** Section 3. Errors and Issues Observed

**Observed Behavior:**
Executing `task create "title" priority "body"` results in an error message indicating a missing function (`this.getLabelsForTask`).

**Expected Behavior:**
The `task create` command should successfully parse the provided arguments (title, priority, body) and create a new GitHub issue, correctly assigning labels based on the priority.

**Remediation:**
Investigate the implementation of the `task create` command and ensure that `getLabelsForTask` (or its equivalent functionality) is correctly defined and accessible within its scope. Ensure proper parsing of priority labels and graceful handling of any missing functions.

issue.title: refactor: Extract shared API client logic into a utility module

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: Improvements to code structure without changing external behavior

labels.name: tech-debt
labels.description: Technical debt that needs to be addressed

issue.body:
### ♻️ Refactoring Request

**Describe the technical debt**
The `activity-analyzer.js` and `claude-enhancer.js` scripts both contain a `GitHubApiClient` and `ClaudeApiClient` class, respectively. These classes have very similar `httpRequest` methods and caching logic. This represents duplicated code that could be consolidated.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
1.  Create a new shared utility script (e.g., `.github/scripts/utils/apiClient.js`).
2.  This new script should export a generic `ApiClient` class or a set of utility functions for making HTTP requests, handling retries, and managing caching.
3.  Refactor `activity-analyzer.js` and `claude-enhancer.js` to import and use this shared utility, removing the duplicated code from each script.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- A new shared API client utility is created.
- Duplicated `httpRequest` and caching logic is removed from the analyzer and enhancer scripts.
- Both scripts now import and use the shared utility.
- The overall functionality of the system remains unchanged.

issue.title: refactor: Extract shared API client logic into a utility module

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: Improvements to code structure without changing external behavior

labels.name: tech-debt
labels.description: Technical debt that needs to be addressed

issue.body:
### ♻️ Refactoring Request

**Describe the technical debt**
The `activity-analyzer.js` and `claude-enhancer.js` scripts both contain a `GitHubApiClient` and `ClaudeApiClient` class, respectively. These classes have very similar `httpRequest` methods and caching logic. This represents duplicated code that could be consolidated.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
1.  Create a new shared utility script (e.g., `.github/scripts/utils/apiClient.js`).
2.  This new script should export a generic `ApiClient` class or a set of utility functions for making HTTP requests, handling retries, and managing caching.
3.  Refactor `activity-analyzer.js` and `claude-enhancer.js` to import and use this shared utility, removing the duplicated code from each script.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- A new shared API client utility is created.
- Duplicated `httpRequest` and caching logic is removed from the analyzer and enhancer scripts.
- Both scripts now import and use the shared utility.
- The overall functionality of the system remains unchanged.

comment.body:
### Resolution: Shared API Client Logic Extracted

This issue has been resolved by extracting the common `httpRequest` and `sleep` utility functions into a new shared module: `.github/scripts/utils/apiClient.js`.

**Implementation Details:**
- The `httpRequest` function, including retry logic and exponential backoff, and the `sleep` utility are now centralized in `apiClient.js`.
- Both `GitHubApiClient` (in `activity-analyzer.js`) and `ClaudeApiClient` (in `claude-enhancer.js`) have been refactored to import and utilize these shared functions.

This refactoring significantly reduces code duplication, improves maintainability, and centralizes common API interaction patterns.

Closing this issue.

issue.title: 📚 Create comprehensive technical documentation with sophisticated presentation

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
### 🎯 **Objective**

Create an eloquent, technically sophisticated documentation suite that captures the complete journey of transforming a failing CI system into a fully operational AI-Enhanced CV platform. This documentation should serve as both a technical reference and a testament to the engineering excellence achieved.

### 📖 **Scope of Documentation**

#### 🏗️ **I. System Architecture Compendium**
- **Infrastructure Topology**: Detailed architectural diagrams and component relationships
- **Data Flow Orchestration**: Complete pipeline visualization from GitHub events to live deployment
- **Integration Matrices**: Comprehensive mapping of all system interconnections
- **Scalability Paradigms**: Growth vectors and extensibility frameworks

#### 🔧 **II. Technical Implementation Chronicle**
- **Critical Infrastructure Restoration**: The methodical resurrection of failing CI workflows
- **Claude AI Integration Mastery**: Advanced prompt engineering and token optimization strategies  
- **Automated Quality Assurance**: Multi-tier validation and linting architectures
- **Performance Optimization Techniques**: Caching strategies, dependency management, and execution efficiency

#### 📊 **III. Operational Excellence Documentation**
- **GitHub Actions Workflow Engineering**: Sophisticated CI/CD pipeline construction
- **Intelligent Monitoring & Analytics**: Comprehensive usage tracking and performance metrics
- **Error Recovery & Resilience Patterns**: Fault tolerance and graceful degradation strategies
- **Security & Privacy Frameworks**: Data protection and access control implementations

#### 🎨 **IV. User Experience & Interface Design**
- **Responsive Design Principles**: Mobile-first, accessibility-optimized frontend architecture
- **Progressive Enhancement Strategies**: Graceful functionality layering and performance optimization
- **Interactive Element Engineering**: Dynamic content loading and smooth transition systems
- **SEO & Web Standards Compliance**: Structured data, semantic markup, and optimization techniques

### 🎭 **Presentation Standards**

#### 📝 **Writing Style Requirements**
- **Technical Eloquence**: Sophisticated vocabulary with precise technical terminology
- **Narrative Flow**: Compelling storytelling that weaves technical details into an engaging journey
- **Visual Hierarchy**: Strategic use of sophisticated emoji combinations for section delineation
- **Professional Gravitas**: Authoritative tone that demonstrates deep technical expertise

#### 🎨 **Visual Design Elements**
- **Sophisticated Emoji Usage**: 
  - 🏛️ for architectural concepts
  - ⚙️ for mechanical/operational elements  
  - 🧬 for complex system interactions
  - 💎 for premium features
  - 🌌 for advanced concepts
  - 🎼 for orchestration and harmony
- **Code Block Excellence**: Syntax-highlighted examples with comprehensive annotations
- **Diagram Integration**: ASCII art, mermaid charts, and architectural visualizations
- **Table Sophistication**: Detailed comparison matrices and specification tables

### 📋 **Deliverables**

#### 📖 **Primary Documentation**
- [ ] **`TECHNICAL_EXCELLENCE.md`** - Master technical compendium (8,000+ words)
- [ ] **`ARCHITECTURE_DEEP_DIVE.md`** - System architecture and design patterns
- [ ] **`CI_RESTORATION_CHRONICLE.md`** - Detailed failure analysis and resolution journey
- [ ] **`AI_INTEGRATION_MASTERY.md`** - Claude AI implementation and optimization strategies

#### 🗂️ **Supporting Materials**
- [ ] **`docs/diagrams/`** - System architecture diagrams and flowcharts
- [ ] **`docs/examples/`** - Code examples and implementation patterns
- [ ] **`docs/troubleshooting/`** - Advanced debugging and resolution guides
- [ ] **`docs/api-reference/`** - Comprehensive API documentation

### 🎯 **Success Criteria**

- **Technical Depth**: Documentation demonstrates mastery-level understanding of all system components
- **Narrative Excellence**: Engaging storytelling that makes complex technical concepts accessible
- **Visual Impact**: Sophisticated presentation that reflects the quality of the underlying engineering
- **Practical Value**: Actionable insights and patterns that can be applied to similar projects
- **Professional Polish**: Documentation quality that exceeds industry standards

### 🚀 **Implementation Timeline**

**Phase 1** (Documentation Architecture): Structure and outline creation
**Phase 2** (Content Development): Core technical writing and diagram creation  
**Phase 3** (Polish & Refinement): Style enhancement and visual optimization
**Phase 4** (Integration & Deployment): Documentation system integration

This documentation will serve as the definitive technical reference for the AI-Enhanced CV System and demonstrate the sophisticated engineering practices employed in its development.

comment.body:
### Update: Workflow Documentation and Initial Structure Completed

As part of the comprehensive documentation initiative for Issue #28, the detailed documentation for all GitHub Actions workflows (`cv-enhancement.yml` and `activity-tracker.yml`) has been completed and placed in `docs/workflows.md`.

Additionally, the initial documentation structure has been established with the creation of the following core Markdown files in the `docs/` directory:
- `docs/index.md` (Introduction)
- `docs/architecture.md` (System Architecture)
- `docs/data_models.md` (Data Models)
- `docs/testing.md` (Testing & Validation)
- `docs/api_integrations.md` (API Integrations)
- `docs/deployment.md` (Deployment)
- `docs/contributing.md` (Contribution Guidelines)
- `docs/script_reference.md` (Script Reference, summarizing JSDoc output)

The `mkdocs.yml` configuration has also been set up to generate the static documentation site.

This marks significant progress towards fulfilling the acceptance criteria of Issue #28, particularly in establishing the foundational content and presentation framework. Further work will involve deepening the content, refining presentation, and integrating more advanced elements as outlined in the issue description.

issue.title: feat: Implement feedback loop for recruiter and peer feedback

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: workflow
labels.description: Related to workflow design and execution

labels.name: feedback-loop
labels.description: Related to collecting and integrating user feedback

issue.body:
### 🔁 Implement feedback loop for recruiter and peer feedback

**Problem Description:**
The current CV enhancement system lacks a formal feedback loop to collect qualitative insights from recruiters and peers regarding the generated CV content. This absence hinders the continuous improvement of the AI's scoring model and content optimization strategies.

**Remediation:**
Implement a mechanism to collect and integrate recruiter and peer feedback into the CV enhancement process. This could involve:
- Designing a simple feedback collection interface or process (e.g., a web form, direct email integration).
- Structuring feedback to be actionable and quantifiable (e.g., ratings on relevance, clarity, impact).
- Integrating collected feedback into the scoring model to refine weights and thresholds for AI content generation.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system can collect structured feedback from external stakeholders (recruiters, peers).
- Feedback is used to refine the AI's content generation and scoring models.
- The feedback loop contributes to continuous improvement of the CV's effectiveness.

issue.title: feat: Implement versioning and change tracking for CV content

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: data-management
labels.description: Related to data storage, retrieval, and integrity

labels.name: versioning
labels.description: Related to version control and content history

issue.body:
### 🔄 Implement versioning and change tracking for CV content

**Problem Description:**
The current system lacks robust versioning and change tracking mechanisms for the various sections of the CV content (e.g., professional summary, experience, projects). This makes it difficult to trace how content evolved over time, understand the impact of AI enhancements, or revert to previous versions.

**Remediation:**
Implement a versioning and change tracking system for CV content. This could involve:
- Storing different versions of CV sections (original, AI-enhanced, human-reviewed) in a structured manner.
- Maintaining diff logs to highlight changes between versions.
- Integrating with Git for version control of data files.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system can store and retrieve historical versions of CV content sections.
- Changes between versions are traceable and auditable.
- Reviewers can easily understand the evolution of CV content over time.

issue.title: feat: Implement human-in-the-loop checkpoints for review

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: workflow
labels.description: Related to workflow design and execution

labels.name: human-in-loop
labels.description: Requires human intervention or review

issue.body:
### 🤝 Implement human-in-the-loop checkpoints for review

**Problem Description:**
The `content-analysis.pdf` document emphasizes that human review remains critical for assessing qualities like tone, narrative coherence, and ethical representation in AI-generated content. The current automated workflow lacks explicit checkpoints for human intervention and feedback.

**Remediation:**
Integrate human-in-the-loop (HITL) checkpoints into the CV enhancement workflow. This could involve:
- Pausing the workflow at specific stages (e.g., after AI enhancement) to allow for human review.
- Providing a mechanism for human reviewers to provide feedback or make manual adjustments.
- Incorporating this feedback into the AI's learning or future enhancement cycles.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The workflow includes designated stages for human review of AI-generated content.
- Reviewers can assess tone, narrative coherence, and ethical representation.
- A clear process exists for incorporating human feedback and adjustments into the system.

issue.title: feat: Implement automated suggestions module based on market trends

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: analyzer
labels.description: Related to activity analysis and data processing

labels.name: enhancer
labels.description: Related to AI content enhancement

issue.body:
### ✨ Implement automated suggestions module based on market trends

**Problem Description:**
The `content-analysis.pdf` document highlights the importance of aligning strategic suggestions with market trends (e.g., focusing on LLMs, MLOps, edge AI, AI ethics). While the AI enhancement process may implicitly consider these, there isn't an explicit, automated module that generates actionable suggestions based on these trends.

**Remediation:**
Develop and integrate an automated suggestions module that leverages market trend analysis to provide actionable recommendations for CV content optimization. This could involve:
- Integrating external data sources on industry trends (if feasible).
- Enhancing the AI's prompt engineering to explicitly generate suggestions aligned with market demands.
- Creating a dedicated section in the AI enhancement output for these strategic suggestions.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system can identify and incorporate current AI/ML market trends into its enhancement suggestions.
- An automated module generates specific, actionable recommendations for CV content based on these trends.
- The recommendations help differentiate the professional profile and highlight unique achievements.

issue.title: feat: Implement multi-dimensional scoring matrix for CV content

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: analyzer
labels.description: Related to activity analysis and data processing

labels.name: enhancer
labels.description: Related to AI content enhancement

issue.body:
### ✨ Implement multi-dimensional scoring matrix for CV content

**Problem Description:**
The `content-analysis.pdf` document proposes a sophisticated multi-dimensional scoring matrix for evaluating CV content across dimensions such as contextual intelligence, linguistic quality, factual accuracy, and strategic relevance. This matrix is currently a conceptual framework and is not yet implemented within the system.

**Remediation:**
Implement the proposed multi-dimensional scoring matrix to provide a more granular and objective evaluation of the AI-generated CV content. This will involve:
- Defining quantifiable indicators for each dimension (e.g., industry vernacular usage, persuasive impact, technical claim verification).
- Integrating automated tools (e.g., grammar checkers, semantic similarity metrics) where applicable.
- Developing a composite scoring mechanism that combines these indicators into an overall quality score.
- Establishing quality gates that trigger revision cycles for content falling below thresholds.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system can generate a multi-dimensional score for AI-enhanced CV content.
- The scoring matrix incorporates contextual alignment, linguistic quality, factual accuracy, and strategic relevance.
- Scores are used to identify areas for improvement and potentially trigger automated or human review processes.

issue.title: feat: Ensure narrative coherence and tone consistency in AI-enhanced content

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: frontend
labels.description: Related to frontend UI and UX

labels.name: enhancer
labels.description: Related to AI content enhancement

issue.body:
### ✨ Ensure narrative coherence and tone consistency in AI-enhanced content

**Problem Description:**
The AI-enhanced professional summary, while concise and results-oriented, may sometimes lack narrative coherence with the more detailed experience sections of the CV. Additionally, maintaining a consistent tone (balancing professional gravitas with marketing impact) across all AI-generated content is crucial for a polished final product.

**Remediation:**
Implement mechanisms to ensure and evaluate narrative coherence and tone consistency in AI-enhanced content. This could involve:
- Developing metrics or heuristics to compare the semantic similarity and tone of the AI-enhanced summary with other CV sections.
- Incorporating feedback loops or human-in-the-loop review processes to assess and refine tone and narrative flow.
- Refining prompt engineering to explicitly guide the AI on maintaining coherence and desired tone.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- AI-enhanced content seamlessly integrates with the rest of the CV, maintaining a consistent narrative.
- The tone of AI-generated content aligns with the overall professional persona.
- Metrics or qualitative assessments confirm improved coherence and tone consistency.
